ratings.comment: Professor Hansen is one of the best teachers I have had. She is incredibly knowledgeable and offers interesting insights in class. She also cares deeply about students, and even though the lecture can be long, I always learn something from what she teaches. She cares a lot about participation, so as long as you spend time reading, you'll succeed

One of my favorite classes of all time. Theres a lot of reading but thats pretty much expected from the history department and the material is really interesting. Shes not the greatest with technology and sometimes gets a bit off topic in lecture but overall you can tell shes really passionate about the topic and cares about her students

Hansen was very nice, but the grading system was harsh. Weekly writing is required, but if you cannot come to the class (regardless of the situation) you are not allowed to turn in your writing, which has a huge impact on your grade. This seemed excessive, since the writing was based on the readings and not on anything covered only in class.

Her lectures are very disorganized and difficult to take notes for. Her slides are too bare for the dense content that she tries to teach. Every week we had about 100+ pages of reading. Her grading criteria was not clear so it was very hard to study for the class. I regret taking it.

Anne is a super sweet lady. I had her as a FIG professor so I got to know her better than students who have her for a big lecture. If you are a decent writer her grading is super easy. She teaches religious studies so obviously there's gonna be a lot of reading, but it is super managable.
I love Professor Hansen! She's incredibly smart and I feel privileged to have had a course with her.

I can't say I learned a lot about Buddhism after taking this class. The readings were incredibly long (about a book per week) but they were interesting enough. She expects a discussion paper every week and as long as you hand that in (which I wrote without reading the whole book all the time) and attend the seminar, you're good.

Despite the other reviews of this professor I thought she was very informative on this subject. She didn't just read off of her powerpoints in lecture, so attendance is mandatory. There are readings every week but you talk about them in discussion. I would recommend this class as I learned a lot about Buddhism.

I took this class as an ethnic studies because religion interests me, however it was miserable. Dr. Hansen assigns well over 100 pages of reading a week, none of which are easy to understand without reading a few times. I walked away with no new knowledge and some excess stress. You can get an A if you put in the effort. I would not recommend it.
Do not ever take this class!! The lecture is unorganized and there are tons of reading per week. And those readings are hard to understand.

Do not take this course. Anne Hansen is a TERRIBLE professor. She assigns around 150 textbook and article pages of reading each week and most of the readings are so confusing and don't make sense. She just gives so much because she has nothing better to do.  Lecture is terribly boring and she speaks in monotone. She sucks at her job and can't teach
easiest class ever if you can write decent essays (AP lit level) will get an A. never really read anything just skimmed and did not discuss at all so easy
Great use of power points and always easy to talk to.

Very nice professor, always seemed sincerely interested in her students. Lectures were a little unorganized, but nothing unbearable. Content extremely interesting and most of the time she explained things clearly. Papers somewhat challenging, much effort was necessary, but exams were easy in comparison. Overall, pretty good professor, great class.

Lectures are inconsistent - some are really important, others can easily be skipped, so you should try to make them all.  Essays and tests are not too hard.  You have to pay attention and work in this class to make it interesting, since Anne is not really a great lecturer even though the content is actually pretty neat.

Ann is awesome! She is so nice, and goes out of her way to help and interact with her students. She even took students to different religion sites throughout the semester. Class did have a lot of reading but I got by without reading everything with an A.
Overall a very nice lady! The class got a lot easier this year. Less reading and the exams were very straightforward and simple. Enjoyable class for broad overview of Asian Religion.

There is a ton of reading in this class. I thought the work and reading, however, was a perfect amount for 600-level seminar. The readings are very interesting and you cover a lot of ground in a little time. Discussion paper due every week, 2 book reviews, ethnographic report, and final paper. She has trouble organizing class time but is super nice
Don't have to go to class, super super boring. As long as you do well on essays and study for exams its not too difficult, but is a lot of work

This class is unreasonable.  You have to read a book a week plus online readings.  There is a final exam and a final paper.  The test require way to much studying for only being 10%.  Her lectures are not helpful and are boring.  It all depends on how well and how easy your TA grades.

Horribly boring and scatter-brained lectures.  She rambles on from unrelated topic to unrelated topic.  She summarizes the readings, but it is very stream of consciousness.  Good teacher for a discussion, horrible teacher for a lecture.

Give this course a chance.  The second half is much more fascinating than the first.  Her lectures can drag on at times, but section was a blast with an awesome TA.  Not very demanding and the Zen Buddhism and poetry stuff is all really cool.

This class was something of a joke. I only went to lecture once a week if that. I barely ever read from any of the assigned texts (there were a lot of them), and everything I learned about them was from the my TA, who was awesome. Writing the papers from a perspective of very basic level of knowledge was a breeze. It was an easy A.

Not a good class to be taken as a power-lecture.  Very hard to stay motivated to go to class.  Generally dragged content out to reach the end of the 75 minutes.  Relatively unrelated subjects.  Some concepts never get cleared up,

This class is very boring. Good thing lecture isn't mandatory. You can pull off a good grade without going to every lecture because all she does is summarize what you read for homework and tell you all her stories about being around Buddhists and stuff. As long as you keep up with the work and you know how to use google, it's an easy A or B
No Comments
